context_of_use: This use case allows users to view and download sales and other business reports for analysis.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: Access reports for personal use
description: Allows users to view and download sales and other business reports for analysis.
triggering_event: User requests to view or download reports.
preconditions: User has the necessary permissions to view reports
postconditions: User successfully views or downloads the requested reports
assumptions: Users have access to the reporting system
Reports are available for viewing and downloading
requirements_met: The system shall allow users to view reports
The system shall allow users to download reports
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of reports available for each user role
Determination of report access levels for different user types
main_flow: 1. customer requests to view reports → System displays available reports.
2. customer selects a report to download → System initiates download of the selected report.
3. power user requests to view reports → System displays available reports.
4. power user selects a report to download → System initiates download of the selected report.
5. admin requests to view sales reports → System displays sales reports.
6. admin selects a sales report to download → System initiates download of the selected sales report.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If no reports are available, System displays a message indicating no reports are available.
AF-2 (from Step 2): If the customer cancels the download, System stops the download process and returns to the report selection screen.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the download fails, System displays an error message and suggests retrying.
EF-2 (from Step 4): If the selected report is not found, System displays an error message indicating the report is unavailable.
